author: vors
body:
If you do now

```
apt-get install powershell
```

You will get version `6.1.0-preview2`.
This version doesn't have corresponding documentation published for `Update-Help` and is not shipped with the documentation built in. (call me if it's wrong, this is my conclusion from this CI failure https://travis-ci.org/PowerShell/platyPS/builds/387162525#L674)

Should the default installed package on linux actually have the documentation or an option to bring it?
title: Documentation publishing for pre-releases
